title: Kindred/wind wall, dilemma
body: Yasuo's wind wall blocks the 3 attack (wolfs bite) on kindred's E. However wolf is part of the champion, just as much as lamb is, and so isn't a projectile but a living moving champion. Therefore he should not be blocked by the wall.

replies.body: If you were to say that then you would have to apply the same logic to Quinn's Blinding Assault, since it's actually Valor (a "living moving champion" as you put it) and not a "projectile".
Valor is a bird, birds dont have feelings, ergo, birds dont count.

Valor tells knock knock jokes tho, how can he not have feelings.

Anivia and Azir are birds too and they have feelings D:

You have a fair point, Valor should indeed be included as a champion and not a projectile! 
the same should be true of Azir's soldiers, they may be mindless zombies but they 'run' under their own steam so how can they be projectiles?

also on a different note i fail to see how thresh's basic attacks dont count as projectiles when his Q does, like how are they different? he still throws a scythe connected to a chain..
Would they not just make Wolf technically a basic attack of Lamb so therefore he would be classed as a projectile
Being a basic attack or not doesn't define if you are a projectile.
But if it's Lamb's basic attack then it is a projectile because she shoots stuff.
But it isn't lamb's Attack tho its wolf's the first 2 are hers but the 3rd one is directed by her but it's him attacking.

right I see what you mean, I thought that wolfs coding was the same as Lamb's basic attacks which would then mean he gets blocked. So he isn't a basic attack but the coding is the same as her basic attack.

Interesting point, I think it would happen rarely enough they could do it without impacting balance much at all. As for the technical side I wouldn't know with their spaghetti code, they might have to change a lot of Wolf's properties to make him not a projectile.

Instead of changing the code of wolf, just add some code to tell the windwall that its an exception instead (like azir/thresh/vel'koz etc's basic attacks). that way they don't need to re-write his code.
I have no idea if that would be possible or if it would even be easier to do so given some of the struggles I've herd from Rioters about trying to fix finicky little things.

> a lot of Wolf's properties to make him not a projectile

A tonne of wolf's properties to make him not a projectile

there fixed it for you


Like come on, it takes around 7 lines of code to say "Hello World" its gonna take a hell of a lot more to change the properties of him.
